intro: Collinsia heterophylla var. heterophylla, commonly known as the Sierra snowball, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and can vary in size depending on the environment. Collinsia heterophylla var. heterophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
